description:
About the job

Core Optimisation is a rapidly growing Digital Marketing and Transformation Agency. We are seeking a Full Stack Software Engineer to join our team to work on a new product build. This platform will integrate data from multiple sources. This role will focus on building secure, modular, and scalable backend services that will handle data ingestion, processing, and storage. 




Key Responsibilities: 




Technical Design & Development: Lead backend development with a focus on designing a modular, scalable architecture using Microsoft Azure services. 
Data Integration: Implement secure data collection from multiple sources via APIs, Webhook integration, ensuring high data integrity. 
Data Anonymisation and Security: Work with data sanitization and anonymization to handle sensitive PII, ensuring compliance with GDPR and data protection standards. 
Database Management: Manage and optimize Azure Cosmos DB for efficient storage and retrieval, with attention to data schema design and query optimization. 
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams including frontend engineers, data analysts, and project managers. 




Required Qualifications: 




Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s in Computer Science or a related field. 
Experience: Minimum 5+ years of experience in full stack development, with expertise in Next.js, shadcn/ui, familiarity with Azure-based services. 
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Azure Functions, Azure API Management, Cosmos DB, CI/CD pipelines, Bicep 
Security & Compliance: Solid understanding of GDPR and experience in data security, anonymization, and hashing techniques, software security scanning techniques. 
Problem Solving: Strong analytical skills, with experience in troubleshooting complex integrations and optimizing backend performance. 
Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to document processes and procedures. 




Preferred: 




Experience with business intelligence platforms and familiarity with cloud-based architecture. 
Prior experience working in a digital transformation or tourism industry context.

About the job

Overview




A leading global financial institution is seeking an experienced SQL Developer to join its Dublin technology team. The successful candidate will work on high-availability data platforms supporting trading, risk, compliance, and regulatory reporting functions. This role involves complex data transformation, optimisation, and collaboration with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced enterprise environment.




Key Responsibilities




Design, develop, and optimise complex SQL queries, stored procedures, functions, and ETL processes across large financial datasets.
Support and enhance enterprise data solutions.
Work closely with business stakeholders to gather and refine data requirements.
Create robust data validation frameworks and ensure data quality across critical systems.
Optimise database performance, indexing strategies, and query execution plans.
Collaborate with application developers, analysts, and data engineers on end-to-end project delivery.
Assist in the migration and modernisation of legacy database systems where required.
Provide production support for high-priority financial systems when needed.




Required Skills & Experience

Hands-on SQL development experience (T-SQL, PL/SQL, or equivalent).
Proven ability working with large, complex datasets in an enterprise or financial environment.
Strong experience with RDBMS technologies such as SQL Server, Oracle, or PostgreSQL.
Excellent understanding of query optimisation, indexing, performance tuning.
Experience with ETL tools 
Strong understanding of data governance and security standards in regulated environments.
Excellent analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills.




This is a daily rate contract role involving three days per week on site.

About the job

Software Developer – Elasticsearch / Kibana 

Location: Remote role (EU Countries)

Employment Type: Freelance contract with extensions

Language Spoken: English and German (Must)




Overview:

For an exciting enterprise project in the energy sector, we are looking for an experienced Software Developer with strong Elasticsearch and Kibana expertise to support the development of a modern data and monitoring landscape.

This role requires a hands-on Elastic Stack specialist who can independently design, implement, and further develop Elasticsearch-based solutions in a complex, regulated environment.




Responsibilities:




Data Integration & Interfaces

Integrate archive systems, DMS, and other enterprise source systems via interfaces and pipelines
Build and maintain structured data flows into Elasticsearch
Prepare and provide data for analysis and dashboards in Kibana

Monitoring & Data Quality

Design and develop modern monitoring dashboards in Kibana
Identify, analyse, and control issues in data and document flows
Create correlation logic to connect events across multiple log sources

Elastic Cluster Design & Development

Design the technical concept and architecture of Elasticsearch clusters
Independently implement system connections and integrations
Continuously improve cluster setup and data architecture based on requirements

Security & Infrastructure

Analyse data sources and technical connectivity options
Consider security aspects such as API management, access rights, and firewall approvals

Data Processing

Clean, transform, and preprocess log and event data
Load data into Elasticsearch with quality and consistency checks




Requirements:

Strong hands-on experience with Elasticsearch, including setup and operation of Elastic clusters
Very good practical experience with Kibana
Experience working with Azure DevOps (repos, pipelines, boards, deployments)
Experience integrating enterprise systems (e.g. archive tools, DMS, SAP-based systems like SAP PO, API platforms)
Strong skills in data cleansing and preprocessing
Analytical mindset with good business understanding
Independent, structured, and delivery-focused working style

About the job

Company Description

At Glitch, our mission is to bring simplicity to complex business processes. Our innovative AI engine empowers high-growth companies to acquire customers more effectively at scale by streamlining strategy development, campaign creation, and content optimisation. By leveraging AI and automation, Glitch provides cutting-edge solutions to drive success. We specialise in helping businesses achieve their goals through efficiency and intelligent tools.




The Role

As an Engineering Intern, you’ll work closely with our CTO and core engineering team on real production systems — not side projects. This role sits at the intersection of product, data, and AI systems, and is designed for someone who wants to deeply understand how modern AI-driven products are built, tested, and improved in the real world.

You’ll help us ship better features, learn how agentic systems behave in production, and contribute directly to improving customer outcomes.




What You’ll Work On

You’ll be involved across the product lifecycle, including:
Testing new features end-to-end and helping identify edge cases before release
Analysing campaign, product, and system data to understand performance and failure modes
Supporting experiments to improve agent and prompt behaviour
Helping turn insights from data and users into shipped product improvements
Working alongside engineers to debug issues and improve system reliability
This is a hands-on role with real responsibility and real impact.




What We’re Looking For

You don’t need to tick every box - curiosity, ownership, and learning speed matter most.




Studying computer science, engineering, data, or a related field
Strong problem-solving instincts and systems thinking
Comfort working with data (even if it’s messy or incomplete)
Interest in AI systems, agents, and how models behave in production
Ability to communicate clearly and ask good questions




Why This Role Is Different

You’ll work on a live, revenue-generating product used by real B2B companies
You’ll learn how AI products actually operate beyond demos and notebooks
You’ll work closely with senior engineers and leadership, not in a silo
You’ll see how engineering, product, and customer feedback connect in practice




Get in touch

If you’re interested please send an email with your resume / portfolio of work to operations@glitchads.ai




Glitch is early. That means fewer rigid processes, more ownership, and more room to grow quickly. If you’re someone who thrives in ambiguity, wants exposure to how startups really work, and is excited by the idea of AI reshaping marketing, we’d love to hear from you.

About the job

Job Title: AI Engineer 

Employment Type: Full-Time 

Location: Nova UCD Dublin




About Better Futures Limited

Better Futures is transforming engineering productivity with EVA — the first AI Assistant SaaS platform built specifically to free engineers from paperwork. EVA automates documentation, verification, and knowledge retrieval so teams can focus on high-value engineering work. 

Founded by Anthony Mc Loughlin and headquartered in Dublin’s NovaUCD, the company has secured early traction with leading manufacturers such as ABB and Sensata Technologies, delivering measurable impact in highly regulated industries. Better Futures has recently brought on new investors and is expanding its team as it scales into a €20B+ global market.




The Position 

We are hiring a hands-on AI Engineer early in their career who is passionate about applying AI to real customer challenges. This role is highly implementation-focused: building, deploying, and improving AI models and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines for real-world engineering applications.

You are someone who loves experimenting, iterating fast, and shipping AI that actually gets used. You take ownership, learn quickly, and thrive in a startup environment where your work has immediate impact.




Key Responsibilities




 AI Engineering & Architecture

Design and optimize RAG architectures for high-quality retrieval and contextual reasoning.
Build and maintain AI pipelines, embedding systems, and model integrations with user friendly UI 
Work closely with the product development team to integrate new pipelines, assistants, and features into our core SaaS platform—enabling scale and continuous improvement.

 

 Pre-Sales & Customer Success 

Build prototypes and novel assistants to unlock new use cases and clients
Support sales by leading demos, evaluations, and Proofs of Value (PoVs)
Understand and document customer requirements.
Lead strategic customer projects, delivering production-ready assistants
Drive usage and adoption, ensuring successful rollout and measurable customer impact.




Requirements




1-3 years hands-on experience building AI pipelines with RAG frameworks (e.g. LangChain, LlamaIndex, Weaviate, Milvus, Pinecone).
Strong skills in PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face, and vector databases.
Deep understanding of embedding models, prompt engineering, and data curation.
Cloud development experience especially Microsoft Azure.
Excellent communication skills to collaborate with customers and internal teams.
Startup mindset: hands-on, fast-moving, adaptable, and eager to learn.




Nice to Have / Bonus




Experience deploying AI in engineering, manufacturing, or technical domains.
Experience in fine-tuning LLMs (LoRA, QLoRA, PEFT, instruction tuning, RLHF).
bubble.io experience 




What We Offer




Competitive salary and equity options
A unique opportunity to work at the forefront of AI to revolutionize manufacturing, engineering and seeing immediate impact in customer workflows.
An exciting pioneering team and company, with huge upside for career growth and learning 
A great culture and environment, working in the heart of Dublin’s startup community at Nova UCD 




If you are excited, please send your CV and a cover letter explaining why you are the ideal candidate for this role via LinkedIn or to info@betterfutures.ai.
